intro: Lindernia montana, commonly known as the mountain lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular, violet or purple flowers. It is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. Lindernia montana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
